pageContext.description: Flanged axe head, straight sided and slightly inclined towards the heel, which is damaged. Blade expanding to crescent shaped, bevelled cutting edge. Sides slightly facetted, and only slightly broader than the thickness of the axe. Very slight bevel-ridge across each face.  One point of the blade damaged.
pageContext.patina: A smooth green patina, somewhat pitted.
pageContext.collection: Newark-on-Trent Municipal Museum,Accession no 797-1,Presented to Museum by Mr. W. Thompson at unknown date before 1917 when it appears in the first printed catalogue, but after 1912 when Museum opened.
pageContext.site: England,Nottinghamshire,Retford,Daneshill,No details of find spot known - see under collection for particulars of date.
pageContext.toSearch: Daneshill Road, Lound, Retford, Nottinghamshire Dn22 8rb, UK
